messages.message:
This is turning a bit hard to root cause. I have observed following behavior:

[1] On safari on my iphone
Works with a security warning [screenshot 1]

[2] On chrome browser on my laptop [*non-incognito mode*]
Fails with invalid certificate message [screenshot 2]

[3] On chrome browser on my laptop [*incognito mode*]
Works without any warnings or errors [screenshot 3]
I think the main issue is the cert that is associated with the button URL is for sendgrid not ib.com (http://ib.com)
One suspect is the following; however I am not convinced yet. https://docs.sendgrid.com/ui/analytics-and-reporting/click-tracking-ssl
Not sure why some browsers just allow it thru and not catch it

> I think the main issue is the cert that is associated with the button URL is for sendgrid not ib.com (http://ib.com)
> Not sure why some browsers just allow it thru and not catch it
same browser (chrome) has two different behaviors on my laptop in non-incognito and incognito modes
We should resolve the cert issue first and understand the proper way to share clickable buttons via sendgrid. We shouldnt be using a domain not associated with the ssl associated

Let's hold on this option please.

I am trying to understand whether we actually need https:// for a public-facing email

another topic I noticed in this thread is zscaler. I do NOT think zscaler has anything to do with this.

It is specific to domains *.sendgrid.net (http://sendgrid.net) and *.instabase.com (http://instabase.com) and some combination of browser (and their modes) and devices (ios/laptop) on which those browsers are running.

^ this message is a FYI

Thanks for the investigation, @Ashish 

As we discussed, I had checked 6 test emails before before sending the mailer. 

For all of them, I faced no issue, with the following configurations. 

[1] On safari on my iphone
Worked without any warnings or errors 

[2] On chrome browser on my laptop [non incognito *mode*]
Worked without any warnings or errors

Later today, I saw the issue with following configurations: 

[3] On chrome browser on my laptop [different user profile, non*-incognito mode*]
Fails with invalid certificate message

Another observation. Not very useful in actually fixing the issue but an observation nonetheless.

On chrome browser, the HTTP request headers sent to the server (sendgrid.net (http://sendgrid.net)) were different between normal window and incognito window. As a result, the HTTP response headers were also different. And, incognito window was able to load aihub whereas normal window wasn't.

*Once I cleared browser cache, both normal and incognito window are working.*

We cannot expect our users to clear cache. I am inching closer to setting up TLS for sendgrid. I'll confirm whether that's the way to go after further investigation.
@Varun Jain let's discuss http vs https in URLs tomorrow
